intro: Pachystylus zippelianus, commonly known as the Zippel's broad-stemmed plant, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its robust, cylindrical stems that can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are alternate, often deeply lobed, and may have a mild aromatic scent. Pachystylus zippelianus is typically found in moist, temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
